results.title: Cerebras, an A.I. Chipmaker Trying to Take On Nvidia, Files for an I.P.O.
results.abstract: The Silicon Valley company would be among the first A.I. companies to go public since the release of ChatGPT nearly two years ago.
results.byline: By Erin Griffith and Cade Metz

multimedia.caption: Cerebras makes a chip that is 56 times the size of a chip commonly used for artificial intelligence, with the potential to crunch data much faster.

results.title: OpenAI Is Growing Fast and Burning Through Piles of Money
results.abstract: As the company looks for more outside investors, documents reviewed by The New York Times show consumer fascination with ChatGPT and a serious need for more cash.

results.title: Cruise, G.M.’s Self-Driving Unit, Will Pay $1.5 Million Federal Fine
results.abstract: The General Motors subsidiary reached a settlement with the main auto safety regulator after one of its self-driving taxis struck a pedestrian in San Francisco last year.

multimedia.caption: Cruise will pay a $1.5 million penalty and face increased oversight of its activities as it restarts testing of its technology.
Cruise will pay a $1.5 million penalty and face increased oversight of its activities as it restarts testing of its technology.

results.abstract: The tech giant is among the many companies building technology that could remake Hollywood — or help spread disinformation.
results.byline: By Cade Metz and Mike Isaac

results.abstract: “In the United States, we have 50 laboratories of democracy and they’re called states.”

results.title: OpenAI Adds $4 Billion Credit Line on Top of $6.6 Billion Investment Round
results.abstract: The San Francisco company is gathering the billions its executives believe they will need to continue building new A.I. technology.
results.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Mike Isaac

multimedia.caption: OpenAI, led by its chief executive, Sam Altman, set up a revolving line of credit with JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Santander, Wells Fargo, SMBC, UBS and HSBC.

results.title: The Private Life of Telegram’s Founder Adds to His Troubles
results.abstract: The mother of three children with Pavel Durov has poked holes in the Russian tech titan’s carefully managed image through a criminal complaint and her account of their opulent lifestyle.

results.title: Did Apple Just Kill Social Apps?
results.abstract: Some app makers worry that a subtle change to the iPhone’s contact-sharing permissions could make it hard for them to get the fast growth they need to compete.

results.title: Tesla Sales Increase, Suggesting Electric Car Demand Is Rebounding
results.abstract: The automaker reported a gain of 6.4 percent for the latest quarter, its first such increase this year.

results.abstract: The initial version of Apple Intelligence focuses on helping you with words and photos. Prepare to be impressed and unnerved.

results.title: A Venture Capital Firm Does Something Rare: Give Money Back
results.abstract: CRV, based in Silicon Valley, plans to return to investors $275 million because the market for mature start-ups has soured.

results.title: Verizon Is Restoring Service After Outages Reported Across the U.S.
results.abstract: The number of cases peaked at more than 100,000 Monday morning, according to the website Downdetector. Users complained of being unable to make calls or send texts.

results.abstract: The bill would have been the first in the nation to place strict guardrails on the new technology, but Gov. Gavin Newsom said the bill was flawed.

results.abstract: Contrary to public reports last year, the passengers probably had no idea that the vessel was about to implode.

results.abstract: Almost a third of 171 posts last week from the X owner were false, misleading or missing vital context.

results.title: Why Is OpenAI Trying to Raise So Much Money?
results.abstract: The San Francisco A.I. start-up believes there is not enough computing power on Earth to build the artificial intelligence it wants to create.

results.title: How to Make Typing Easier on the Phone and Leave the Laptop at Home
results.abstract: Shortcuts, small external keyboards and even improved (and free) dictation software can make long sessions of text input much simpler.

results.title: Caroline Ellison, Star Witness at FTX Trial, Is Sentenced to 2 Years in Prison
results.abstract: A top adviser to Sam Bankman-Fried, the disgraced founder of FTX, Ms. Ellison pleaded guilty to conspiring with him to steal $8 billion and became a crucial witness for the prosecution.

multimedia.caption: The former FTX executive Caroline Ellison, leaving federal court in Manhattan on Tuesday, received a harsher sentence than many legal experts had expected.
